titles.title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to authorize an estrogenic substances screening program.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Transportation and Infrastructure
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

term.name: Waste disposal in rivers, lakes, etc.

bill.summary: 5/5/1999--Introduced. Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to authorize the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to provide for testing under the estrogenic substances screening program authorized by the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act of any substance that may be found in discharges of pollutants into navigable waters if the Administrator determines that a substantial population may be exposed to such substance.
